AG: No decision on retrying Cahill after mistrial declared

Judge declares mistrial in Cahill case

Attorney General Martha Coakley said she hasn't decided yet whether to retry ex-treasurer Timothy Cahill on corruption charges. (Boston Globe, 4:28 p.m.)

Court records offer graphic details of Wakefield man's alleged child abuse

John Burbine pleaded not guilty today to over 100 counts of child abuse and rape as prosecutors released chilling details of his alleged crimes. (Globe, 1:41 p.m.)

Senator-elect Elizabeth Warren will have a seat on the Banking Committee -- befitting her previous role as a watchdog on banks and Wall Street. (Globe, 4:35 p.m.)

Owner of Mike's Pastry dies

Michael Mercogliano (left), the "Mike" behind the North End's famed Mike's Pastry, which attracted visitors from around the world, has died at age 90. (Globe, 5:15 p.m.)
